## ğŸ“Œ Installation  
Install via NPM:  
```sh
npm install spotidownloader
```
Make sure you have **Node.js** installed before using the package.  

---

## ğŸ”¥ Usage Example  
Hereâ€™s a quick example of how to use **Spotidownloader** in your Node.js project:

```js
const SpotifyDL = require('spotidownloader');

(async () => {
    const track = await SpotifyDL.get('https://open.spotify.com/track/7eRieAYqAG7rBEOMlvR0xy');

    if (track.error) {
        console.error('Error:', track.error);
    } else {
        console.log('ğŸ¶ Track Info:', track);
        console.log('ğŸ“¥ Download Link:', track.download);
    }
})();
```

## ğŸ§ Features  
âœ” **Fetch Track Info** â€“ Get song title, artist, album, cover image, release date, and duration.  
âœ” **Direct MP3 Download** â€“ Instantly grab the MP3 file.  
âœ” **Lightweight & Fast** â€“ No unnecessary dependencies.  
âœ” **Simple API** â€“ Just call `.get(url)` and receive track details.  

---

## âš¡ API Response  
Hereâ€™s what you get when you fetch a track:  
```json
{
  "title": "In Lab",
  "artist": "Blakdyak",
  "album": "Noon at Ngayon",
  "cover": "https://i.scdn.co/image/ab67616d0000b273b710265f2f2ff055cc0c9a10",
  "released": "1997",
  "duration": 198,
  "download": "http://spotifydl-api.gleeze.com/5f7839ea1782"
}
```
- **`title`** â€“ Name of the song  
- **`artist`** â€“ Artist(s) of the track  
- **`album`** â€“ Album name  
- **`cover`** â€“ Album cover image URL  
- **`released`** â€“ Year of release  
- **`duration`** â€“ Length of the song in seconds  
- **`download`** â€“ Direct MP3 download link  

---

## â— Notes  
- This tool **does not bypass any restrictions** and only works with an **unofficial API**.  
- The download link is generated by a third-party service.  
- Some tracks **may not be available for download** due to licensing restrictions.
